title: Ticket #3242: remove an interactive job if client interrrupted before it starts
description:
When the user runs condor_submit -interactive, they may have to wait quite a while for the job to get scheduled. If the user hits ctrl-c or closes the window before the job starts, the job should be immediately removed from the queue.

Implementation For now, handle this simply via an interrupt handler in ssh_to_job that catches ctrl-c (SIGINT), windows closing (SIGHUP), etc, and have the interrupt handler remove the job. This handler is installed via the command-line switch -remove-on-interrupt to ssh_to_job; this switch is used by condor_submit -i.

Note this solution still leaves a window of vulnerability if the user hits ctrl-c after condor_submit completes but before ssh_to_job spawns. This could be handled in the future via a lease on the job that gets renewed every time ssh_to_job polls to check if the job is running.
